Happy to share that I‚Äôve successfully completed the Quantum Fundamentals (2025‚Äì2026) program.

This 4-week program, jointly conducted by Amaravati Quantum Valley, Qubitech, and WISER, provided a strong foundation in quantum computing concepts and was equivalent to one academic credit.

It was a valuable learning experience that strengthened my understanding of emerging quantum technologies and their future impact.

content:
üéÆ Workshop Project | Air Strike Feature (Unity)

During a recent Game Development Workshop, I worked on implementing an Air Strike feature in a tank-based game using Unity.
My contribution was focused on this specific mechanic ‚Äî handling its logic, triggering it during gameplay, and integrating it smoothly into the existing game setup. It was a great hands-on exercise in understanding how individual features are built and connected inside a larger project.
Small feature, big learning üöÄ

Looking forward to applying these learnings in future projects and Web PagesüöÄ

content:
Proud to announce I've earned the Linux Essentials certificate from Cisco Networking Academy, in collaboration with NDG! Through this course, I've strengthened my skills in Linux system navigation, mastering the command line, and understanding security and file permissions. This milestone is a step forward in my journey as a Linux administrator and open source enthusiast. Awarded October 17, 2025.

title: üöÄ From Logic Gates to AI: Tracing the Evolution of Technolo...
excerpt:
üöÄ From Logic Gates to AI: Tracing the Evolution of Technology ü§ñ
Proud to have presented our poster and research on the evolution of computer technology ‚Äî a journey from the simplicity of logic gates...
content:
üöÄ From Logic Gates to AI: Tracing the Evolution of Technology ü§ñ
Proud to have presented our poster and research on the evolution of computer technology ‚Äî a journey from the simplicity of logic gates to the complexity of modern artificial intelligence.
Our work highlighted how:
 üîπ The 1960s introduced binary logic circuits ‚Äî the foundation of computation.
 üîπ The 1970s brought microprocessors, powering the personal computer revolution.
 üîπ The 1990s connected the world through the Internet.
 üîπ The 2010s saw the rise of AI ‚Äî machines that learn, adapt, and reason.
What began as simple electrical switches has grown into systems that now simulate human thought and decision-making.
This experience not only deepened our understanding of tech evolution but also reminded us of one thing:
 üí° Innovation is built layer by layer ‚Äî every chip, code, and connection counts.
Grateful to my team who supported this journey. Excited for what lies ahead!
Bommisetty jyothi for suggesting this topic!!

content:
üöÄ Exciting News!
I'm incredibly happy to share that I‚Äôve joined GeeksforGeeks as a DSA Intern! üéâ

Being part of this amazing journey means a lot to me ‚Äî from solving countless problems to diving deep into the core concepts of Data Structures and Algorithms, this opportunity is not just about learning, but about growing with one of the most trusted platforms in tech education. 

A big shoutout to Sudheer Reddy mitta, Sagar Mamwadi, and NEKAL SINGH SALARIA for your constant support, guidance, and motivation throughout this journey. Your encouragement truly made a difference. üôè

Looking forward to sharpening my problem-solving skills, contributing to the community, and becoming a better version of myself each day. Let‚Äôs keep building and learning!

During a recent Game Development Workshop, I worked on implementing an Air Strike feature in a tank-based game using Unity.
My contribution was focused on this specific mechanic ‚Äî handling its logic, triggering it during gameplay, and integrating it smoothly into the existing game setup. It was a great hands-on exercise in understanding how individual features are built and connected inside a larger project.
Small feature, big learning üöÄ
